chapter.title: Edition
chapter.subtitle: Plugin Edit
chapter.para: The Edit plugin allows user to edit geographical data on the browser

sect2.title: edit.ini
sect2.para: Here are the options that can be set on the client:

listitem.para: general.allowedRoles: comma separated list of the roles that are allowed to use the edit plugin
insertedFeaturesMaxNumberinsertedFeaturesMaxNumber: integer, number of new features that user is allowed to draw for insertion in the database
Set it to 0 if user is only allowed to update or delete features.
editLayerseditLayers: comma separated list of layers that are editable
editResultNbColeditResultNbCol: number of columns to use to display the attributes table
editDisplayActioneditDisplayAction: this boolean parameter is used to tell if the "validate" and "cancel" buttons have to be displayed also under the attributes table

sect2.title: Metadatas
sect2.para: Specific metadatas must be set in the mapfile for the editable layers
sect2.programlisting: METADATA ... 'edit_table' 'edit_poly' # PostGIS table 'edit_geometry_column' 'the_geom' # PostGIS geometry column 'edit_geometry_type' 'polygon' # PostGIS geometry type 'edit_srid' '-1' 'edit_attributes' 'parc_id,name|string,culture|string,surf,parc_type|integer' # list of the editable fields END

listitem.para: edit_tableedit_table: string, name of the postGIS table to edit
edit_geometry_columnedit_geometry_column: string, name of the geometry field in the table
edit_geometry_typeedit_geometry_type: string, type of the geometry of the features for the layer
possible values are point, line, polygon
May differ from the msLayer type (rendering)
edit_sridedit_srid: integer (optional), id of the SRID
edit_attributesedit_attributes: string, comma separated list of attributes used for edition.
Each value represents the attribute name and type separated by a pipe symbol. Only attributes with type set are editable.
Attribute types available values are string and integer.

sect1.title: How to
sect1.para: In this section are described the steps to get the edit plugin working on a cartoweb project.

formalpara.title: First, you need a PostgreSQL database with postGIS enabled.
formalpara.para: Let's say, it is named "edit_db" for the following explanations.

formalpara.title: At that point, you may launch edit_db.sql

listitem.para: This will create 3 sample geometry tables, one for each type of geometry.

formalpara.title: In &cartoweb;, you'll have to load the edit plugin in your project on both client and server sides.
Then, you'll need to configure the plugin by setting the layer_ids in the editLayers parameter in the edit.ini file.
In your mapfile, in the corresponding LAYER, you'll have to set the specific metadatas as following :

para.programlisting: LAYER NAME EDITPOLY STATUS ON TYPE POLYGON CONNECTIONTYPE POSTGIS CONNECTION 'dbname=edit_db user=www-data password=www-data host=localhost' DATA 'the_geom from (select the_geom, oid, parc_id, name, culture, surf, parc_type from edit_poly) as foo' TEMPLATE 'ttt' [...] LABELITEM "name" CLASS NAME "class" STYLE COLOR 50 50 255 OUTLINECOLOR 255 50 50 END LABEL [...] END END METADATA 'id_attribute_string' 'parc_id' # query 'query_returned_attributes' 'parc_id name culture surf parc_type' 'edit_table' 'edit_poly' # PostGIS table 'edit_geometry_column' 'the_geom' # PostGIS geometry column 'edit_geometry_type' 'polygon' # PostGIS geometry type 'edit_srid' '-1' 'edit_attributes' 'parc_id,name|string,culture|string,surf,parc_type|integer' # list of the editable fields 'edit_filter' '' # mapserver filter END END
